V.iii.9.1.e
.
Characteristics of Sickle Cell Anemia
Sickle cell anemia is a morbid state characterized by hemolytic anemia and the following manifestations
the presence of peculiar sickle-shaped, or oat-shaped, red blood cells
signs of excessive blood destruction and active blood formation, and
repeated vaso-occlusive episodes.
